intro: Gaillonia eriantha, commonly known as the velvetleaf or velvetleaf hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa, Asia, and Australia. It is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves that are covered in a dense, velvety down, giving it its common name. The plant produces showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink and yellow, typically blooming during the warm seasons. Gaillonia eriantha is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its striking foliage and vibrant blooms. It thrives in full sun to partial shade and requires well-drained soil to prevent root rot.
